intro: Nierembergia pubescens, commonly known as the hairy bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant has hairy foliage and stems, which give it its common name. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Nierembergia pubescens is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
